page.title: 12Tourism - Festival
page.content: The Lake Windermere Festival is a week-long series of events held early in July, partly to help attract visitors to the area. The Festival is somewhat controversial, residents describing it as a noisy nuisance and organisers complaining that locals do not give it enough support. The range of events in the programme is very wide and this year included an opening parade led by the Dagenham Girl Pipers, beauty competition (one of the judges being a blind man), celebrity football match, cookery competition, marathon disco, a top cycling Grand Prix, veteran and vintage car fun run, fell pony show (including 17th. century bare-back trotting racing), decorated raft race, power boat racing and a running/ swimming/cycling triathlon.
